content_parts.content:
Mapping field controls

To preserve modifications and facilitate upgrades, the Sage Intacct Mapping page includes the following enhancements to the Mapping tab grids:

  • The Editable column indicates which fields can be edited. Only fields with this column selected can be modified.
  • The Description, Required, Data type, and Read-only columns are hidden, but can be displayed using the Column settings panel.
  • Property option was renamed Default property to display the standard value if the field was renamed.

Performance enhancement for finance

When you integrate finance documents, they are processed asynchronously to improve performance.

You can monitor the journal entry integration status on the Integration page and sort by Master data or Finance.

content_parts.content: To let you know that a task is finished, a notification displays when a bill of material export is completed, a journal entry is generated, and an MRP calculation request is completed.

content_parts.title: Attribute and dimension controls on standard cost value changes

content_parts.content:
To avoid errors with Sage Intacct integration, you can define required attributes and dimensions at the company and/or account level.

When you define required attributes and dimensions, you cannot enter a stock value change or update the cost details of a standard cost item if the required settings are missing or if a GL account is not set up for journal entries.

content_parts.title: Dimension controls for purchase orders and purchase receipts

content_parts.content: Entering purchase orders and purchase receipts is blocked and a warning displays if attributes, dimensions, or GL accounts are missing, and if required dimensions defined for a company or an account are missing.

content_parts.title: Landed cost posting for purchase receipts

content_parts.content:
To get a more complete view of total costs for purchased goods when you enter a purchase invoice, you can allocate landed costs to one or more associated purchase receipts by activating the landed cost service option.

When you post the invoice, respective landed cost accrual and purchase price variance entries are generated. New account types for landed cost accruals and landed cost expenses were added to the detailed item posting class.

You can create custom forms and reports using a visual interface where you can design the layout, select colors, and add your own text. You can display data in a table or in blocks for a single record or a list of records. A preview window updates in real time. Switch to an advanced version to get direct access and control over GraphQL data queries, HTML code, and custom style sheets.

content_parts.content:
The new Standard cost calculation function calculates the costs for selected items and their sub-assemblies corresponding to the bill of material hierarchy and routings.

Subsequently, item-site costs can be created/updated with these calculated costs.
If you change the cost of an item-site record that is costed at standard cost when there is stock on hand, a journal entry is generated for the adjustment.

Stock reordering is improved to reduce the number of pages that need to be accessed to obtain results:

  • The MRP calculation result page was renamed MRP calculation.
  • On the MRP calculation page, you can run an MRP calculation and view the results of the MRP calculation.
  • When an MRP calculation run is completed, a notification displays in the Notification center. You can go straight to the results from the notification.
  • On the MRP calculation page, from the main list, you can delete one or multiple MRP calculation results sets.

To adjust the average cost or FIFO value of stock on hand, use the Stock value change page to edit the cost per unit or the total value of the stock of a specific item at a specific site. To ensure accuracy between stock values and the financial system, a journal entry is created for the stock value changes.

When entering a stock value change a check is applied whether all required dimensions defined at the company level and/or account level (Sage Intacct integration only) have been entered for the given transaction. This also includes a check of whether all the GL accounts required to generate the associated journal entries are available.

content_parts.content:
For sales and purchasing documents, you can perform several key actions from the main list to save time.

Additional actions include:

  • Revert
  • Open
  • Create document
  • Accept all variances

Specific actions available depend on the document type and your user permissions.

You can navigate to related pages without losing your place and returning to the main menu.

Select the hyperlink to return to the previous page or pages by following the breadcrumbs.
You can also right-click the hyperlink to open in a new browser tab.
